content.description: Predicting the outcome of code. (2016 Fall, Final, Question 14 a)

p.line: Consider the problem of wanting to determine if a list is a set (i.e., every element is unique, there are no duplicates). What's wrong (if anything) with each of the following 3 attempts? (select ONE from each legend)
B = It will cause an error or run forever.
E = If it's the empty list, _EMPHS_true_EMPHE_, otherwise it always returns _EMPHS_false._EMPHE_
F = If it's the empty list, _EMPHS_false_EMPHE_, otherwise it always returns _EMPHS_true._EMPHE_
G = If it's the empty list, _EMPHS_true_EMPHE_, otherwise it only returns whether the _EMPHS_first_EMPHE_ element is in the list multiple times.
H = If it's the empty list, _EMPHS_true_EMPHE_, otherwise it only returns whether the _EMPHS_last_EMPHE_ element is in the list multiple times.

content.hint: Be aware of the role of report.
